# <type>: <subject>
#
# Types:
#   feat     - A new feature or enhancement
#   fix      - A bug fix
#   docs     - Documentation changes
#   test     - Adding or modifying tests
#   refactor - Code changes that neither fix bugs nor add features
#   chore    - Maintenance tasks, dependency updates, etc.
#
# Rules:
#   - Subject line should be 50 chars or less
#   - Start subject line with a capital letter
#   - Do not end subject line with a period
#   - Use imperative mood in subject ("Add" not "Added" or "Adds")
#
# Example commit messages:
#   feat: Add support for ACRCloud provider
#   fix: Resolve memory leak in audio processing
#   docs: Update installation instructions
#   test: Add test cases for config validation
#   refactor: Simplify track identification logic
#   chore: Update dependencies to latest versions
#
# For larger commits, you can add a body after a blank line:
#
# <type>: <subject>
#
# <body>
#
# Example with body:
#   feat: Add support for multiple audio providers
#
#   - Add provider interface for audio recognition
#   - Implement Shazam provider
#   - Add fallback mechanism for multiple providers
#   - Update documentation with new provider setup
